title: Brits out! (Irish newspaper, undated)
Additional information: Front cover of ‘The Starry Plough’ magazine, published by the Irish Republican Socialist Party (IRSP), showing a British soldier and a dead civilian against a green background. The IRSP was founded in 1974 by Seamus Costello, then-leader of the Official Sinn Féin party, who was later killed in an attack apparently conducted by the Provisional IRA.
